args:
The siblings obtain smoke signals from a
bag that washed ashore. The prince goes with
his brothers to raise a rescue signal, but an
interloper foils the attempt. What's more,
Leonidas falls from a cliff protecting Emile from
a second fiend, forcing the group to withdraw.
But Leonidas! I'm telling you, I just made\na bad call, that's all! If the result is the\nsame, it's hardly worth worrying about.
You are thoughtless. Our language\nlacks words descriptive enough to\nencapsulate your sheer idiocy.
I'm surprised to see you together. Not that\nyou look to be cooperating... Care to fill\nme in on what's going on?
Nothing, save me expressing disgust at the\nprofound depth of my brother's imbecility.
All I said is that I didn't see the import in\nmerely starting a fire.
＂Merely＂? Clearly, you still lack even the\nmost basic understanding of your error!
Oh, er, no, it was just a figure of speech—
Listen here! I will tell you one more time.\nTo survive, a person needs access to\nair, water, food, shelter, and fire.

Fire is particularly essential for a variety of
tasks like heating, water purification, and
cooking. Access to fire can spell the
difference between life or death!
If you would make light of it with such\ndiminutive words, you cannot possibly\nhope to survive!
You must cast aside your pride and fight\nto live with all your body and soul! Do I\nmake myself clear?!
Your silence indicates your assent.\nHurry up and gather firewood.
He sure didn't look convinced.\nAre we sure he's going to be okay?
Hmph. It's none of my concern.
What of your efforts? Did you succeed in\nsecuring provisions and finding anything\nfrom the shipwreck?
Keen as ever, dear brother. Even without\nus saying a word, you knew what we were\nup to.
Spare me. I simply made an educated\nguess as to what measures you'd take.
Brother, does that mean you planned\nto work with us from the very start?
It is axiomatic that cooperation is the\nsurest way to survive. The only one who\nhadn't a mind for it then was Emile.
I took action alone because I believed that\nit would be more efficient to gather the\nnecessary elements for survival individually.
With that done, I move that we act jointly\nfrom this point forth. Likely Chelle has\nalready reached the same conclusion.
Indeed. There are only four of us here, so\nwe siblings should join hands in harmony\nand help each other.
Given your wording, may I assume that\nyour cooperation thus far has borne fruit?
But of course. I am quite certain that you\nwill find this to your liking, my brother.

Is that...a tube for launching
pyroblossoms? Wait, no. It must be
a similar tool that applies the same
principle to launch smoke signals.

Keen insight, dear brother. Using these
smoke projectors, we can convey our
presence on this island from a great
distance.

Being a prototype, it still needs a number
of adjustments, but so long as we move
clear immediately after lighting it, it
should serve our purposes without issue.
How precisely does one use them?
While we made our way here, I gave a full\nexplanation to {player_name}.
Good. Let us waste no time, then.
*wheeze* *pant* I'm back...and this\nshould give you—hup!—nothing to\ncomplain about.
Wait here, Chelle. {player_name}\nand Emile, with me!
But I JUST finished getting firewood!
You could always stay here and cook\ndinner for us instead.
What?! By myself? What if I get attacked\nby fiends?!
Then you'd have to deal with it yourself.\nIf you don't like it, then you can go with\nour brothers.
But nobody's even told me WHERE\nwe'd be going, and for what!
Huh?! Wait! I have no idea what's\ngoing on... I said WAIT, damn you!
*sigh* There's a decent chance he'll die.
This spot should suit our needs.\n{player_name}, do it.
Got it. You two stand back a little.
Hmph. That's excessive explosive power\nfor a smoke signal, but it does appear to\nbe functional.
Now we just have to hope someone sees\nit.
IT'S BAAAACK! THAT'S THE MONSTER\nTHAT CHASED ME!
It appears to be the master of the island.\nIt saw the signal and came here to stand\nin our way.
Agh, the smoke! Now I'm doomed...\nDOOOOOMED, I SAY!
And our ＂friend＂ here will interfere with\nevery shot, no doubt. We won't be able\nto call for help unless we defeat it.
Wait... But that thing is crazy-go-nuts\nscary! Fighting it would be ABSURD!
I could crush a runt like this without\nbreaking a sweat. Hraaah!
They're seriously both going for it...
If I could, I would too...but I'm not strong\nthe way they are.
Keep pushing! We've got it pinned do—
NO! He went over the cliff!
Hrk... We have to back off for now.\nCome on, Emile!
Damn it all! Let go of me...\nI said let go, damn you! LET GOOO!
